documentation.introduction: BLAKE is one the five finalists of the NIST SHA-3 Competition. It follows the HAIFA iteration mode, has a local wide-pipe internal structure and uses Bernstein's stream cipher ChaCha (a variant of Salsa20) as its compression algorithm.
documentation.usage: The BLAKE component has two inputs and one output. Input Stream is mandatory and connects to the data to be hashed. Salt is optional, but if it is used its size must be 16 bytes if you pick either BLAKE-224 or BLAKE-256. For the other two functions (BLAKE-384 and BLAKE-512) its size must be 32 bytes. In the component settings you can select the BLAKE hash function you want to use (BLAKE-224, BLAKE-256, BLAKE-384, BLAKE-512).
